pageContext.claim: “For all of the money we are spending, NASA should NOT be talking about going to the Moon - We did that 50 years ago. They should be focused on the much bigger things we are doing, including Mars (of which the Moon is a part), Defense and Science!”
pageContext.analysis: This is a puzzling tweet on several levels. Trump in 2017 signed a space policy directive that ordered NASA to return to the lunar surface, which was followed by a speech by Mike Pence in 2019 giving the agency a five-year deadline. Trump's budget calls for spending $1.6 billion on the effort. Moreover, the moon is a satellite of Earth, not of Mars.
